title: How to Make Raspberry Leaf Tea

steps.headline: Add the chopped raspberry leaves to the cup of boiling water.
Cover the cup.
steps.description: Use a cup lid or an overturned plate to cover. Allow to stand for 5 minutes to let the raspberry leaves steep.

steps.headline: Remove the cover and strain the tea into another cup or mug.
Drink.
steps.description: You can enjoy two cups a day of this tea during the last two months of pregnancy but it should not be taken any earlier in pregnancy. Moreover, always check with your physician before taking raspberry tea during pregnancy as you may have complications that the doctor should warn you about. If you're not pregnant, the tea is still good for you; it helps to prevent spongy bleeding gums, mouth ulcers, and mouth soreness.

methods.name: Raspberry Leaf Tea in a Tea Pouch

steps.headline: Fill a tea pouch with dried raspberry leaves.
steps.description: Tea pouches can be purchased from health food stores and tea stockists.

steps.headline: Put the tea pouch containing raspberry leaves in 1 cup of boiling water.
Let the pouch sit for 5 minutes.
Take out the tea pouch.
steps.description: The tea is now ready to serve.

text: Raspberry Leaves Add the chopped raspberry leaves to the cup of boiling water.  Cover the cup. Use a cup lid or an overturned plate to cover. Allow to stand for 5 minutes to let the raspberry leaves steep. Remove the cover and strain the tea into another cup or mug.  Drink. You can enjoy two cups a day of this tea during the last two months of pregnancy but it should not be taken any earlier in pregnancy. Moreover, always check with your physician before taking raspberry tea during pregnancy as you may have complications that the doctor should warn you about. If you're not pregnant, the tea is still good for you; it helps to prevent spongy bleeding gums, mouth ulcers, and mouth soreness. Raspberry Leaf Tea in a Tea Pouch Fill a tea pouch with dried raspberry leaves. Tea pouches can be purchased from health food stores and tea stockists. Put the tea pouch containing raspberry leaves in 1 cup of boiling water.  Let the pouch sit for 5 minutes.  Take out the tea pouch. The tea is now ready to serve.
